entry.title: Announcement: Google Drive for Drafting
entry.content:
If you'd like to see a preview of the yet-to-be-published chapters, and maybe help with some editing or feedback, I have created a folder in my Google Drive in which I will keep the drafts.

When I started this blog, I didn't expect that anyone would read my story, but now I have to take into account the fact that people will read posts shortly after they have been published.  This complicates matters if I want to make changes, which I frequently do.

So from now on, whatever is published on the blog will be pretty much the finished product, with very rare exceptions of course.

Get in touch with me via e-mail or the Facebook page if you'd like me to give you access to my drafts.

-- Alex

I really enjoyed your posts on Facebook. You May not knowing me by the way, lol. But I'm a fan of you. I knew you vía Long Haired Men Group. And believe me, you encouraged me to do things that I never thought I could make it. Words are not only words. They have truly power. And about your decisión to leave Facebook, I think it's okay. I did it once and I decided to return. And I keep on my list only to those peeps that I really know and want to be keep in touch. Just one word to describes what I feel, a Big Thank You for All your posts. And good luck for the next year. Be happy, Alex.

entry.title: Chapter VIII: A Conversation about Womanhood
entry.content:
http://www.flickr.com/photos/21183810@N00/3831421129/sizes/l/

Turgolga and Yamizert walked out the front entrance, leaving Odessa and Trousers alone in the living room.

“Trousers, I think I’ll have to stay here for a while until we can work out how to get away,” Odessa said quietly.  “And besides, I’d like to learn more about this Council.  In the meantime, why don’t you go exploring?  Just be careful of those horrible ogres, don't let them catch you.”

Trousers sat up very straight and puffed his chest.  “Don’t you worry about me, Odessa,” he replied, “I am a Pathfinder.”

“And besides,” he thought to himself as he zoomed up the rough stone wall and out through the window, “I need to show her that I’m more than a carry-on kitty.”

Turgolga returned with a decorated cube rock as tall as Odessa’s shoulders and placed it next to the floor table in the middle of the living room.  She gestured for Odessa to sit at the table with her.  Odessa hopped up on to it with a graceful wall-run.  Turgolga sat down with her legs crossed at the table.

“Now, tell me, little creature, what was your name again?”

“Odessa.”

“Odessa, yes, that’s right.  Tell me, Odessa, what does it mean to be a woman and what does it mean to be a girl?”

“It means lots of things, and it doesn’t always mean the same thing to everyone, but here's the way I see it.  When we're small, boys and girls can do pretty much the same things.  I always liked playing outside and climbing things, but even then I noticed that a lot of other girls preferred to play indoors.”

“Did you play with boys?”

“Yes! They were much more fun to play with than girls.”

“Wasn't it hard for you to keep them in check?  Ogresons are always so difficult to keep in line, if you give them an inch they'll terrorise you all day.”

“I didn't need to keep them in check; we just got along.  We didn't think much about the differences between us; we simply played.  Aren't young ogresses hard to raise as well?”

“Young ogresses can be tricky sometimes.  Take my Yamizert, for example.  She reminds me of myself when I was her age.  She asks a lot of questions, and doesn’t always see the obvious truth, but she’ll come around.  I look forward to the day when she joins me on the Council.  I worry sometimes that she’s a little soft on the ogresons, but she'll learn how to keep the ogre of her choice in his place.  Tell me, what happens when you get older?”

“As the boys grown into men and the girls into women, things change between us; it’s not as simple as it used to be.  When we're very young, boys and girls are about the same size; then girls get bigger than the boys; then before you know it, those same little boys are much bigger and stronger than we are.”
 
“Does that mean you have only a small window in which to teach the boys their place, while you are bigger and stronger?”

“I never thought of it that way, but I remember a girl called Susie who liked to hit boys.  For a while all the boys our age were afraid of her, but then one day Susie tried to hit a boy who had just had a growth spurt.  Instead of crying, he hit her back, and much harder than she had hit him.”

“Oh, how terrible! What happened to that nasty little creature?”

“She stopped hitting boys after that.”

“No, I meant the ogreson, I mean, boy.  Are boys allowed to hit girls?  Are men allowed to hit women?”

“Oh, well, boys aren’t supposed to hit girls, and a man who hits a woman would be in serious trouble, but in this case everyone knew how mean Susie was, so no-one said anything.  The other boys were quite relieved and the other girls didn’t like the way Susie had always carried on.”

“What a wicked society, if a boy can get away with hitting a girl!  Imagine allowing an ogre to hit an ogress!  It boggles my mind just thinking about it!”  Turgolga took a breath to steady herself.  “Well, Odessa, I’m glad you have a chance to see our civilised culture.  You have a lot to learn from us.”

Odessa nodded politely.  They sat in silence.

“Tell me, Odessa, why don’t you have a proper belly like mine?  Are all of your people so skinny?  Do you not have enough to eat?”

“Oh no, we vary quite a lot, especially when we grew into women.  Obviously, we get taller and stronger, but we also become softer, or rather certain parts of us get more squishy.”

“Ah, I see! Yes, that happens to us too.  I could see how the ogres started probing me with their stupid round eyes when I grew into a full ogress -- I had to hit quite a few of them for subjecting me to their ogre-gaze, let me tell you!” Turgolga laughed.  (Odessa laughed politely with her)  “I always longed for the day when I could show off my belly; I was so delighted when mine began to peek out from under my top.  Yamizert is starting to get a round belly, but, poor thing, she needs to eat a lot more if she is to achieve a respectable shape.”

“Where I come from, women generally prefer not to be so round, and most men like women who aren't very big.”

“That makes no sense to me.  Why would it matter what a man thinks of you?”

“It's not the be all and end all, but if there is a man that I like, and he doesn't find me attractive, then he won't want to be with me.”

“What do you mean, he won't want to be with you?”

“He won't go out with me, he won't be interested in me.”

“Do you mean to say that you ask him?

“Usually you don't have to ask; if he likes you, and you like him, then you’ll usually find a way to let each other know.  It can happen anywhere -- on the street, at a party, even in a hospital.”

“Does that mean you wait for him to come to you?”

“Well, I suppose I do.  If he’s really cute but shy, I might have to take the first step!”  Odessa smiled reminiscently into the distance.  “When I see someone that I connect with, and our eyes meet, and he starts walking towards me, I feel the most wonderful butterflies in my stomach.”  Odessa sighed.  “But if he walks away suddenly, those butterflies turn to lead.  And then you wonder whether it was all a dream…”
Odessa looked up at Turgolga.  “It's just the way it works for us, I guess.”

Turgolga shook her head.  “What a curious thought!  It would be the height of absurdity for an ogre to make advances on an ogress.  What would an ogre know about these sorts of things?  I chose Tazagthrog and that was that, although I sometimes wonder why I put up with him.”

“How did you meet Tazagthrog?  How did you know to choose him?”

“He came too close to me one day in the square, when I was sitting with my friends.  None of us was a Council Member back then, but we were already very wise in many matters.”

“Tazagthrog came too close?”

“Ogres must keep a respectable distance.”

“Why must they keep a respectable distance?”

“It would be scandalous for an ogre to violate an ogress’s space; we can’t allow those oafs to walk all over us and terrorise us with their large bodies!”

“What is a respectable distance?”

“Whatever an ogress wants.”

“What happened then?”

“I couldn’t allow this moron ogreson to humiliate me in front of my friends, so I jumped up to box his ear, but when I looked into those round blue eyes he had before his Cleansing, I was strangely reluctant to put him in his place.  I punched him just below the ear, but gave him a few good kicks to make up for it.  It’s shameful, I know; I could never tell a Council Member that I was so soft on him.  I don’t think anyone knows.”

“Didn’t that hurt him?”

“Ogresons don’t break as easily as your people.  We have to hit them very hard to get the message across, especially after they get their scales.  Anyway, as he dropped to the floor, I took care not to kick him too close to his ears.  After that day, I kept my eye on him.”

“To keep him in line?”

“Yes, of course, to keep him in line,” Turgolga said with a hint of a smile.  She looked into the distance for a moment and shook her head as if to clear away something inside her mind.

They sat in silence for a while.

“That was fascinating, little woman Odessa,” Turgolga said. “You women are the strangest, ugliest creatures I’ve ever seen, and I can’t say I understand how things work with you, but we ogresses have to work hard to keep the ogres in their place.  Maybe men are a little smarter than ogres.”  The strangeness of this idea made her snort mirthfully.  “Speaking of which, the Council for Creation and Improvement will assemble here shortly, so set yourself up in that corner there and try not to make any noise.  It’s almost time for breakfast, so I’m going to see where my good-for-nothing ogreman Tazagthrog is.”

Odessa lay down in the corner of the room and took a sturdy, leather-bound notebook from her backpack.  She unclipped a pencil from its cover and began to sketch absentmindedly.  She didn’t think herself much of an artist, but sketching and writing helped her to collect her thoughts, and she wanted to reflect on her recent encounters with the Man in the Mountain.  Was it really the Man’s fault that all those people got trapped in his mountain?  Had the Man always intended to make the mountain such a horrible place?  Maybe it wasn’t meant to be a mountain at all, just a place where people could live together and lean on each other in hard times.  From what the first Comrade told her (poor Comrade!), he had nothing but good intentions.  “Perhaps good intentions only count for so much,” she thought to herself.



The Odessia, a fantasy novel by Alexander J Garber is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
Permissions beyond the scope of this license may be available at http://www.theodessia.com.

For more information, check us out at http://www.theodessia.com or get in touch via the email form on Blogger, on Facebook or Google+, YouTube or Tumblr.
Reminded me somewhat of Plato's cave, they seemed quite intent on stifling any disagreement in there. Content in their "perfect" prison.

entry.title: Stretch Therapy Session #1 at Melbourne Physical & Natural Studio (16th January 2015)
entry.content:
Friday, 16th January 2015.

I am encouraged by my first session with Graeme Shrapnel at Melbourne Physical & Natural Studio.  After I gave Graeme an overview of what had brought me to him -- hip impingement, tight right hamstring, tendency towards lordosis when standing, slouching when sitting -- he used a detailed 3D representation of muscles on his computer screen to point out the areas he would initially investigate.  He has clearly built up a professional understanding of physiology in theory and in practice.

After my treatment, I felt remarkably relaxed and light.  Graeme's assessment directly addressed my pain points and gives me hope that there is a credible alternative to surgical treatment of my femoro-acetabular impingement.

Graeme's studio is affiliated with Kit Laughlin, whose YouTube videos are an excellent source of information for anyone interested in stretching, FAI, or just general wellbeing:


(Preliminary) Conclusion
As I have only been there once, it is too early to make an appraisal of the efficacy of stretch therapy. Nevertheless, Graeme is has given me most of what I specifically asked for:
  1. A detailed assessment of the defects in my posture and muscular imbalances.
  2. A set of exercises to ameliorate this condition.
  3. A space in which I can essay this approach.
The only thing I'd have liked further is a written definition of the goals and a timeline of my treatment, but I can define my goals as simply to correct the below-listed defects; and, given the unquantifiable variables of my own body, it is probably impossible to say how long it'll take for me to see significant results.

At any rate, I will do these exercises every day and update this blog post with my thoughts and observations.

Assessment

  • Right psoas muscle is weak, stiff, and shortened.
  • Piriformis muscles, both left and right, are tight and short.
  • Right hip is rotated forward.
  • Right leg seems slightly shorter on account of hip tension.
  • Tendency towards anterior pelvic tilt.
  • Right quadriceps muscles are stronger than the left.

Treatment (once a day)

Hip Flexor Stretch

Instructions

1 set x 5 reps (building up to 10 over the course of a week)

Lying backwards on floor, resting on elbows.
Raise straight leg up and out, at about 45 degree angle.
Slowly lower the leg to the floor whilst counting slowly to 10.
Repeat on the other side.

Thoughts and Observations

When I tried it in my session, my upper hip flexor got tired after four repetitions.

Pectoral and Biceps Stretch

Instructions

  1. Lie face down on the floor.
  2. Extend left arm slightly above shoulder, rotate hand forward to face thumb towards your chest.
  3. Right hand placed flat on floor close to shoulder, elbow up.
  4. Push on right hand and slowly roll over outstretched arm, rolling right back over left, to increase the stretch.
  5. Hold for 30 seconds.
  6. Repeat on the other side.

Thoughts and Observations

An excellent stretch that I will do often, as I spend a lot of time on the floor anyway.

Piriformis Stretch and External Hip Rotation (chair version)

Instructions

  1. Sitting on the edge of the chair, supporting foot flat on the floor, place ankle of other leg across knee of supporting leg.
  2. Draw navel to spine lifting up chest to straighten back and angle hips forward.
  3. Take a deep breath; as you breathe incline your body towards your top foot, bending only at the hips.
  4. To come out of the stretch, push back with both arms.

Thoughts and Observations

I get pins on needles in my right leg when stretching my right side. 
My right side also relaxes less readily than my left.
As my hips are very tight, I need to bend my supporting leg quite a bit.

Buttocks and Hip Flexor Stretch

Instructions

  1. Start in a wide kneeling lunge, square hips facing forward, relax muscles around the waist and gently increase the lunge.
  2. Deep breath, on out, lift chest and extend torso forward on to hands.
  3. Two contractions: press foot into floor and draw backwards towards buttocks.  At the same time, press hands into floor, draw back lifting chest.
  4. Deep breath, on out, left and extend chest forwards moving on to elbows, raise back foot on to toes straighten back leg.  (Knee off the floor)
  5. Hold position for 30 seconds.
  6. Lift back on to hands keeping back leg straight.
  7. Contract buttock of back leg, lift chest and slowly push hip of back leg towards the floor.
  8. To come out of the stretch, drop  your back leg to the floor, sit for a while in relaxed Cossack stretch, and push up with your hands to stand up.

Thoughts and Observations

Nothing to add at the moment.

Upper Thoracic Stretch

  1. Standing position, arms behind back, fingers laced and palms together.
  2. Deep breath, on breath out, draw hands down over buttocks, arching back slightly, and contract muscles behind shoulder to draw them together. (Scapular retraction)
  3. Hold for 5 seconds and repeat 3 times.

Thoughts and Observations

 This is an excellent stretch, which can be done throughout the day, especially after working on the computer.  I intend to do this stretch at work and make a habit of doing it after driving in the car as well.  (I'd like to write a separate blog post about stretches to do after getting out of the car)

Seated Lumbar Stretch

  1. Sit on floor -- soles of feet together and knees bent.
  2. Hands placed near ankles.
  3. Draw navel towards the spine.
  4. Maintain a straight back, bend from hips, lift up chest and draw chest towards feet.
  5. Hold stretch about 10 seconds.
  6. (C) Clasp feet and draw torso forwards.
  7. (R) Deep breath, on out breath lift chest and draw towards feet.
  8. Hold stretch for 30 seconds.

Thoughts and Observations

Nothing to add at the moment.

Kneeling Hamstring Stretch

Instructions

  1. Commence in a left side kneeling lunge.
  2. Bend forward at hip, placing chest on right thigh.
  3. Slowly stretch right leg to feel stretch in hamstring. (10 seconds)
  4. (C) Contract muscles gently by pushing right into floor. (5 seconds)
  5. (R) Relax and take a deep breath.
  6. On breathing out, straighten leg a little further, maintain chest-to-thigh contact.
  7. This can be achieved sliding foot forward or moving bottom backwards.
  8. Hold for 30 seconds.
  9. Repeat on the other side.
  10. At completion of stretch give legs a little shake.

Thoughts and Observations

 This is by far one of the most difficult stretches I have performed.  My right hamstring is perennially tight -- this is one of the reasons that brought me to Graeme -- but beyond this source of pain, performing this stretch makes me feel upset.  I believe that a lot of negative emotions (owing to trauma in childhood) are stored in my muscles, especially my lower back, and deep stretches of muscles that attach to the core of my nervous system will induce waves of anxiety, anger, or distress.  After completing the stretch on both sides, I needed a minute to calm down, and thereafter I felt that it had been cathartic.  Graeme said that a lot of people report going through this tempest during these deep stretches.  At any rate, I'm fascinated to find out how I get along doing this stretch over the next few weeks.

Scapular Retraction on Chin-up Bar

Instructions

  1. Hang from a bar with your arms straight.
  2. Draw your attention to your scapulae and try to squeeze them together.

Thoughts and Observations

In order to retract my scapulae, I really have to engage the muscles from the top of shoulders all the way down the chain to my shoulder blades.  I don't know if it is possible to squeeze my shoulder blades together in isolation, but maybe the point of the exercise is to recruit all of the muscle that work to keep your shoulders up and stable, rather than slouching.

***
This blog and all contents herein are available under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence. Please share freely and let me know if this helps anyone.

entry.title: What using Free and Open Source software means to me
entry.content:
Almost all of what I do on the computer is done with Free or open source software.  This video was recorded on an Android smart phone and was edited in OpenShot Video Editor on Ubuntu GNU/Linux.  I use Firefox as my primary browser, edit images in GIMP and Inkscape, edit audio in Audacity, and use LibreOffice for documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.  I am a fan of Blender, dabble in WordPress, and have learned some BASH and Python.

All of my original-content YouTube videos are released under a Creative Commons licence, and my videos use only CC images, music, sound effects, mostly from Flickr and dig.ccmixter.org.

I believe wholeheartedly in the importance of intellectual freedom, have reservations about the benefits of applying copyright to artistic content, and support the abolition of software patents.

My knowledge of the main proprietary operating systems, Microsoft Windows and Apple MacOSX, is exponentially deeper for having ascended the steep learning curve of advanced Linux desktop usage, but my enjoyment of them will be forever sullied by the unfavourable comparison of their restrictions and limitations with the freedom and flexibility of using GNU/Linux well.


To make Free and open source software the mainstay of my computing is akin to making central to my life such practices as recycling, eating organic produce, conserving water and energy, buying Fair Trade products, and volunteering for a charity.  To understand the importance of freedom of computing on the one hand and my rights to keep my own data private and under my control on the other, is to accept such principles as universal enfranchisement, women's rights, and all other democratic freedoms and liberties.

But using Free and Open Source does not come at the expense of convenience or profit.  I work most efficiently on GNU/Linux, browse most comfortably in Firefox, and have profited in my business ventures from work done in OpenShot and GIMP, for example.  Many stock exchanges today run on Linux-based systems, practically the entire internet is underpinned by Free and open source software, and the most popular smart phone operating system, Android is open source.  Furthermore, even the success of Apple, which is in practice antithetical to computing freedom, is founded on FreeBSD, an open source kernel, which enabled it to develop MacOSX and iOS for its computers and touch-screen devices.

entry.title: Printable Book Form Now Available
entry.content:
Some people like to read blog posts, others prefer to print out what they're going to read.


To make it easier for those of you who still enjoy the traditional ink-and-paper approach, all of the published chapters of The Odessia are available in a single Google Doc.  Simply click in the Page link above called "Printable Version" and you will be taken to the Google Doc.  From there you can download it as a Word DOC, LibreOffice ODT, or PDF, amongst others.

Every week a new chapter shall be added both to the blog and the Google Doc.

Here's a video on how to print from Google Docs:

I'm getting into this now, ch 1 was a bit heavy handed, ch 2 was a good giggle, then I had trouble navigating here (blogger's a bit like that; buggy). Was worth it though, the narrative seems to have matured quite nicely, this is very entertaining, strikes a nice balance between humour and observation.

entry.title: Squatting As A Rest Position
entry.content:
For the last couple of months, I've been making a point of squatting during my lunch break instead of sitting, either in a chair or on the floor.  I heat up my lunch in a bowl, take it outside, and settle down.  When I started, I'll admit, it was difficult; over time, I built up from a couple minutes to five minutes, five to ten, ten to fifteen, and eventually got up to twenty minutes solid in a squat.

Today something encouraging occurred to me: it's not hard anymore.  In fact, it's harder to sit in a squat leaning back against a wall than simply on my own two feet.  (Against a wall, there's more pressure on my knees on account of a greater tendency to tilt my pelvis posteriorly)

What's more, I enjoy the pressure of my hamstrings against my calves: everything feels in its place, all the components are stacked up.  Honestly, I wouldn't be surprised if I dozed off on a hot summer's day.

I don't know when the squat genuinely became a resting position for me, rather than a position to get better at, but here I am, feeling more comfortable than against the wall, or even in a chair!

entry.title: Improve Your Posture Dramatically With This One Easy Tip!
entry.content:
There is an oft repeated parable about a young man who asks a wise elder for one principle to live by, rather than a whole set of rules. The elder tells him never to tell a lie. The young man, thinking that this injunction permits him to engage in licentiousness and dishonourable conduct, readily promises to follow this advice.
However, the young man soon discovers that without the option of lying about his deeds, he has to bear the full cost of his misdeeds, which soon become more trouble than they are worth. And so, even though he intended to live indulgently and decadently, his oath of honesty forced him on to a path of virtuous restraint. And, if you're wondering, the young man lead a full and happy life.

In my own life, I am always on the lookout for simple adjustments to my daily routine that make me stronger, fitter, more alert, and more balanced. And of late a seemingly small but momentous change presents itself to me:

Quit Facebook.

"What do you mean? Surely not to leave Facebook altogether! "

Yes, that's what I mean. Think about it:
How much time per day, per week, per month, do you spend on Facebook, hunched over your phone or slouching at your computer? What would you do if you had all that time back? How would your posture, your breathing, your sleeping patterns, your creative energy, your hips and back and shoulders all fare?

Moreover, given my predilection for arguing with people online and collecting amusing memes, being on Facebook simply takes too much time away from all the other things I want to do in the hours available to me outside work: working on The Odessia and other writing endeavours, keeping house, working out at the gym, getting to sleep early, making videos on YouTube, blogging, etc.

In addition to that, I find it harder to clear my mind and remain in a state of equanimity when I have spent time on Facebook.  My writing suffers for this, and I suspect that other intellectual endeavours are as well.

"If it's simple, why don't you quit Facebook today?"

Because Facebook has become useful and convenient in the following respects:
  1. Keeping in touch with friends
  2. Getting invitations to parties and sundry social gatherings
  3. News, opinion pieces, blog posts
  4. Online discussions
  5. Broadcasting my own content
"So what are you going to do about it?"

In order not to be dragged back to Facebook, I have to find alternatives.
The following alternatives may be useful to you.

KEEPING IN TOUCH WITH FRIENDS
  1. Email
  2. Skype
  3. Google Hangouts
  4. Voxer

INVITATIONS TO EVENTS AND GATHERINGS
  1. Have meaningful friendships
  2. Ask to be invited by email

NEWS, OPINION PIECES, BLOG POSTS
  1. RSS
  2. Subscription by email
  3. Voxer
  4. YouTube

ONLINE DISCUSSIONS
  1. Google Hangouts
  2. Voxer
  3. Skype
  4. Comments threads of blog posts
  5. Message boards

BROADCASTING MY OWN CONTENT
  1. Keep a blog
  2. Keep a YouTube channel
  3. Use Twitter

"Alright, when will you take the plunge?"

First, I will dust off my blogs,  make sure they're shipshape, and collect them all into one main blog.
Next, I will download all my photos and content from Facebook.
Next, I will put together a final post outlining my decision to deactivate my Facebook account for the foreseeable future, and call on people who wish to stay in touch to contact me.
Then one week after that post I will deactivate my account.

Wish me luck!

entry.title: Chapter XI: Trousers' Report on Ogressia
entry.content:
https://www.flickr.com/photos/e-basak/5781414509/sizes/l
Trousers reported:

“This city, Ogressia, is in the middle of a vast quarry in the heart of a mountain range.  Those who first came here must have hollowed out solid rock.  The cave that we entered by, which they call the Old Entrance, is on the north side (or the dark side); at the southern end of the quarry floor is a tunnel that leads to an opening on the side of the mountain range.  Ogres file in and out of there all day, transporting supplies from the outside.

“Don’t tell me you went out there.”

Trousers stretched nonchalantly across her lap.  “I couldn’t very well investigate it from a distance, now could I?”

“Trousers, I told you to be careful!”

He nuzzled her stomach and in spite of herself Odessa stroked his chin.  “I was careful, but I was after all on my first official mission.”  Odessa moved to argue with him but he cut her off.  “ -- At any rate, they didn’t see me.  When I emerged into the open I saw where the ogres got all their food and supplies from.  On the mountain side and down into the valley, there are acres of lush grass, where the ogres keep teeming flocks of sheep, herds of cattle, tribes of goats, and droves of pigs, for which they built the grandest barns and sties I’ve ever seen.
“At the foot of the mountain range is a tremendous expanse of flat lands, which has been cultivated for crops of every kind.  They have all sorts of grains, vegetables, and fruit.  In addition to the cultivated land, I saw a couple of mines in the distance and a deep, dark forest from which they carrying loads of lumber.  From the looks of it, most ogres work outside from morning until night.”

“What about the ogres in Ogressia?”

Much the same.  All around the city the ogres are busy working -- they build, repair, mend, and carry all day long, except for midday and tea time.”

“What happens then?”

“It’s most curious.  When a gong in the middle of the city is struck at midday, all the ogres down tools and disappear into manholes around the city.  About half an hour later, the gong is struck again, and they re-emerge, with a large handful of food, which they gulp down, and then return to work.  When the gong is struck in the afternoon, they all rush to the amphitheatre, also known as the Ogre Dome.

“How wretched,” she whispered.


Trousers didn’t reply.  Odessa had obviously never been hunting; she didn’t understand the thrill of the chase, the power you feel coursing through your veins when you go in for the kill.  He unsheathed his claws reflexively; when she looked down at him, he looked up at her with with an expression of perfect innocence.

Odessa stroked him tenderly as she fell back against the wall and sighed.

“What about the ogresses?  What do they do?”

“I saw a few ogresses walking around the city; or sitting in circles eating and talking.  There were a few who seemed to be supervising the ogres outside, but they spent most of their time snoozing in the fields.”

“I wonder why they’re not allowed to work with the ogres,” Odessa mused.

“Maybe they don’t have to.”

Yamizert appeared at the front entrance.  Odessa and Trousers held their breath.  Yamizert walked unsteadily into her room, oblivious of their presence.  There was a dull thud as she flopped on to her bed; loud snores soon followed.

“Well done on an excellent report,” Odessa whispered.  “I can't say I'm pleased you took such risks, but at least you weren't spotted by anyone.”

“Well, there was one ogre who spotted me -- “

“Trousers! I told you to be careful!”

“Don’t fret Odessa, he handled me very gently --”

“Handled you? Do you mean he caught you?”

“It's funny you should say that –”

“Funny?  What do you mean?  Did he catch you?”

“Yes, he did catch me, but only because he shook the branches so powerfully – “

“ – Branches? Now what are you talking about?”

“Don't worry, Odessa, he's my friend now – “

“ – Friend? How can you befriend one of those monsters?”

“He's not a monster, Odessa, you just haven't got to know him yet.  His name is Tazagthrog and he's Turgolga's husband.“

Odessa caught the words that were about to fly from her mouth and considered Trousers' reply.

“Tazagthrog, Turgolga’s husband?  I saw him today during the Council meeting.  He seemed quite gentle, not at all the way Turgolga talks about him.”

“Yes, and the way he described her, you’d think he was her pet dog, although not nearly as stupid, of course.

“Trousers, dogs aren’t dimwits,”

“You only say that because they'll praise you to high heavens for the chance to chase a ball.”

“Let’s not get into that now.  Tell me about Tazagthrog, please.”

“I know this sounds strange, but he has a secret cave out in the forest in which he draws exquisite ink sketches on parchment.”

“Ink sketches on parchment?”

“Yes, he stumbled across a hidden cave one day and found a collection of sketches in there, which inspired him to manufacture his own parchments and even mix his own ink.”

“Where did he learn to sketch?”

“He’s a natural talent!  He didn’t even know the words for sketching, ink, or parchment, but he can draw like a savant.”

“What has he sketched?”

“He showed me a landscape sketch; a most flattering portrait of Turgolga on the day of their wedding, purely from memory; an exquisite view of the city from the top of those stairs we came down from; and a very strange scene that I can’t make head nor tail of.”

“What does it depict?”

“It’s a large burning wooden cross  in the middle of an open space.  It looks like someone is tied to the cross, but the way he drew it the flames almost completely obscure the victim.  I tried to ask him about it, but he clammed up and put the sketch away.”

“What do you think it means?”

“He clearly wanted me to see it, but more than that I cannot say.”

“Maybe he's not ready to tell you yet.”

“Perhaps.”

“Well, I’m proud of you, Trousers.  You have been very brave, although I must say you did worry me.”

“Don’t you worry about me, Odessa.  I’m a Pathfinder.”

“I know! And an excellent one at that.”

Odessa gave him a squeeze and a kiss and then turned on to her stomach to resume her sketching.  Trousers stepped curled up in the small of Odessa's back.  It wasn’t the most comfortable position for Odessa, but she couldn’t refuse Trousers a comfortable spot after all his hard work, now could she?  Her eyelids grew heavy and she put away her book.  She gently put the sleeping Trousers next to her on the floor, curled up around him, and soon fell asleep with his purrs in her ears.

The following morning, Odessa woke up to see Yamizert sitting next to them.  She had an ornate wooden box in one hand and a hunting knife in the other.

Yamizert kept her eyes locked on Odessa as she slowly lowered the knife into the wooden box.  “Get ready for Yugherkug’s Cleansing, we’re about to leave.”


The Odessia, a fantasy novel by Alexander J Garber is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

entry.title: My Physical Goals
entry.content:
Eliminate my symptoms of femoroacetabular impingement.
Walk without stumbling over my right foot.
Sit on the floor comfortably in an L shape.
Correct lordosis when standing.
Correct kyphosis when sitting.
Reduce tension in my neck and shoulders.
Place palms comfortably on floor when standing with straight legs.
Clean muscle-ups.
Technical handstand.
Technical cartwheel without pain.
Technical roundoff without pain.
Consistent back tuck.
Consistent running front tuck.
Back handspring.
Side splits.
Front splits, both sides.

entry.title: How To Install Cyanogenmod 12 on a Samsung Galaxy S5 G900I on Ubuntu Linux 14.04 with Virtualbox
entry.content:
INTRODUCTION

The purpose of this post is to save you time.  I tried every which way to install Cyanogenmod 12 on my Samsung Galaxy S5 G900I without resorting to a Windows Virtualbox, but nothing I tried worked.

If you have a Windows machine, it will be easier on the Windows machine.  If you have nothing but a Linux PC, here's what to do.

KEY POINTS

  • This guide is a supplement to the official HOW TOs.  I don't have time to put together a Grand Unified Manual on this, but if you familiarise yourself with the official guide and do some googling, this should direct you away from dead ends and help you get the job done quickly.
  • CM for S5 G900I is kltedv.  If you find another version works, good for you, but that's what I stuck to.
  • Heimdall DOES NOT work any more for Samsung Galaxy S5 G900I.  I tried versions 1.3.2, 1.4.0, and 1.4.1.  I didn't compile it, but the reports from the forums suggest that won't work either.
  • If Odin gets stuck, take the USB cable out, plug it back in.  For some strange reason Odin sometimes communicates with the S5 after doing that.

PREPARATION

  1. Virtualbox from the repositories (sudo apt-get install virtualbox*)
  2. Windows (any version) virtual machine on Virtualbox.
  3. Make sure you have the extension pack to enable detection of USB devices. (Download from the www.virtualbox.org)
  4. Download Odin for Samsung (3.0.9)
  5. Download CM for kltedv.  Copy to the virtual machine.
  6. Download and install the Samsung drivers in the virtual machine.
  7. Download TWRP recovery for kltedv.
  8. Download the GApps package for your version of kltedv.

EXECUTION

  1. BACKUP ALL YOUR DATA.
  2. Copy TWRP and GApps to your phone's external SD card.
  3. Turn off your phone.
  4. Launch your virtual Windows machine.  
  5. Launch Odin 3.0.9
  6. Boot into Download mode: Volume Down + Home + Power
  7. Connect your phone to the PC by USB.
  8. In Virtualbox connect your phone to the virtual machine.  Odin should recognise it.
  9. In the AP section, select TWRP.
  10. Press START.
  11. Give it about 2-5 minutes until you see "SUCCESS" in green.
  12. Disconnect your phone.
  13. Turn off your phone.
  14. Boot into Recovery mode: Volume Up + Home + Power
 If you boot into TWRP, you're on the home stretch and can follow the official guides from here on.

entry.title: Rolfing and Skepticism
entry.content:
The Status Quo


There are two competing theories about FAI:
  1. Pincer impingement and/or CAM lesion.  The reason I get pain when I squat or kick is that the CAM lesion on my right femoral head hits against the acetabulam and may have already caused labral damage.  The only efficacious solution is a surgical operation, namely arthroscopic osteoplasty and possibly chrondoplasty.
  2. Muscular weakness, resulting in hypertension and/or hypermobility in the muscles governing the movements that cause me pain.  This can be corrected over time through alternative treatment and a tailored exercise programme.
At this stage in my battle with FAI (femoroalacetabular impingement), I am on the path to surgery, which is likely to happen in mid-2015 or late 2015.  In the meantime, I will seriously consider every credible alternative to surgery.

Goals

Before I go on, I must explicate what I'm doing all this for.

Prevention of Injury and Degeneration


Flexibility

 

Balance and Strength

Peace of Mind

Alternatives To Surgery

Self-treatment

A particularly good proponent of the view that FAI symptoms can be overcome is

Rolfing


 
  1. Self-treatment



I am considering paying for a course of Rolfing treatment.  From what I have read, it promises to help me progress in areas that have long eluded me.

However, before I put down good money for this, I need to establish what standards and tests apply here.

I, like many others, have all too often fallen into the trap of delivering myself into the hands of a practitioner whose treatment is of limited efficacy.  Unless there is very clear evidence of a fault or physical defect that cannot be corrected without somebody's intervention, I owe it to myself to explore all the possibilities for self-treatment and self-correction.

At this stage in my battle with FAI (femoroalacetabular impingement), I am on the path to surgery, which is likely to happen in mid-2015 or late 2015.  In the meantime, I will seriously consider every credible alternative to surgery



A good starting point for any alternative treatment is to see what the critics and skeptics have to say about it:
http://skepdic.com/rolfing.html
http://www.npr.org/2010/12/06/131735132/rolfing-back-in-vogue-but-with-shaky-evidence
http://galwayskeptics.blogspot.com.au/2011/04/have-you-been-rolfed.html
http://skeptics.stackexchange.com/questions/16664/is-rolfing-an-effective-treatment-for-bad-posture
http://debunkatron.com/
http://www.dailystrength.org/health_blogs/teamds/article/rolfing-a-massage-that-hurts-but-helps
http://www.internationalskeptics.com/forums/showthread.php?t=80784

entry.title: How To Adjust a Provision-ISR AHD Camera Light Sensor
entry.content:
by Alexander Garber

 Provision-ISR AHD cameras are made to switch seamlessly between day and night modes to give excellent coverage around the clock.
There are times when the settings need to be adjusted.
Two occasional problems an installer might face are these:
  1. The camera switches to Day mode (and then back to Night mode) during the night.
  2. The camera switches to Night mode during the day.
If you are using a 1080p Provision-ISR AHD recorder, the camera settings can be adjusted from the DVR itself; if you are using a 720p recorder, you’ll have to use the joystick on the camera itself.
OSD MENU INSTRUCTIONS
Press the camera joystick to summon the OSD menu.
Go to Option 5: Day&Night
  • If the option is "EXT", click to go to the sensor sub-menu.
  • If the option is not "EXT", toggle left or right until you arrive at "EXT".  The other options are as follows:
Once you are in the Day&Night sub-menu, you will see these default settings:


Toggle left or right to adjust the delay.
  • Day to Night (D-N)
  • Night to Day (N-D)
If you have a camera switching frequently to day mode at night, increase the N-D delay to 6 seconds.
If you have a camera switching frequently to night mode during the day, increase the D-N to 6 seconds.
Here is an example:
You can also set the camera to remain on "color" mode, even at night:


Or black-and-white mode, regardless of the amount of light available:

But the default setting is "auto":

entry.title: How To Take a Screenshot of Recorded Footage on a Provision-ISR DVR/NVR
entry.content:
by Alexander Garber

 The following guide uses the free open source video player VLC to conveniently extract a still image from footage recorded on a Provision-ISR video recorder, and also meets the Victorian legal standard for video evidence admissible in court.
Backup as “DVR”
Convert
Extract Still Image in VLC

Backup as “DVR”

Insert a USB drive into one of the USB ports on the DVR/NVR.
Select “Backup” from the main menu.
Select the Event and click Backup.


In “Save File Type” you can select either DVR or AVI.
DVR is encoded with a proprietary codec that can be played only with the Backup Player.  This open complies with Victorian legal requirements for admissibility of video evidence.
AVI is an open format and does not comply with Victorian legal requirements for admissibility of video evidence, but for the purposes of reviewing footage and extracting stills it is very convenient.

Convert

Super Player, which can be bundled with the DVR export option, has an option to convert footage to AVI.

Extract Still Image in VLC

When you play the footage, you can extract a still image at the desired point.

You will find the snapshot in the Pictures folder.

entry.title: Banana Biscuit Recipe
entry.content:
Banana Biscuit Recipe

INGREDIENTS

  • About 20 bananas
  • 1 cup of potato flour
  • 1/2 cup of almond meal
  • 1/2 cup of cinnamon
  • 1/2 cup of cocoa or cacao
  • 1 tablespoon of vanilla essence

PREPARATION

  1. Pre-heat the oven to 180 degree celsius.  If you intend to bake for longer than 90 minutes, bake at 160 degrees
  2. Line a baking tray with baking paper.  The thicklier you spread the mix, the longer it will take to bake through, and the more moist it will be in the centre.

INSTRUCTIONS

  1. Mash the bananas thoroughly in a large mixing bowl.  A potato masher comes in handy.
  2. Mix in the potato flour.
  3. Mix in the almond meal.
  4. Mix in the cinnamon.
  5. Mix in the cacao.
  6. Mix in the vanilla essence.
  7. Spoon the mix into the baking tray.  The recommended depth is about a centimetre.  If it fills to about an inch in depth, it is recommended to take out the tray after 90 minutes, allow to cool, and then slice it to a thickness of one centimetre and then put it back in for another 90 minutes.
  8. Alternatively, you can put the slices in a dehydrator.
  9. Allow to cool and keep in the fridge.
The banana biscuits are made without preservatives, but they should last about two weeks if stored in the fridge, although they usually get eaten by then.

If you re-heat them, the cinnamon and cocoa flavour will become more prominent.

entry.title: Chapter VI: The Cave in the Canyon
entry.content:
Chapter VI: The Cave in the Canyon


Bridge #135 took Odessa and Praetorius Pathfinder XII (known to his friends as Trousers) into the depths of a canyon.  They arrived at the opening of a great cave high up in the wall of the sheer cliff.
As they stepped off the final slat exploded in a rush and the rest of the bridge disintegrated and faded into the darkness.

In the morning sun, Odessa’s shadow stretched into the cave, but beyond the entrance it fell into darkness.  Odessa pulled out a flashlight from her bag.  It had been a birthday present from a strange old man who joined her family on their travels for a while.  When they set up their stalls and street performances, he walked around town chatting with people and somehow always convinced them to buy something or see a show.  He never rushed, yet he always got everything done.  He wore long flowing clothes and had a long white beard; he was the only adult Odessa knew he understood what her animals were saying.  On her birthday, he gave her the flashlight and promised her that as long as she looked with an open heart it would show her the way.

Trousers sniffed the air suspiciously.  “I don’t like the smell of this place,” he said.

The walls of the cave narrowed to a tall, broad tunnel.  There were animal bones and brown smears on the walls, and the sound of water dripping.  They reached a fork in the tunnel; Odessa stood there, wondering which way to go, when she heard lumbering footsteps and the sound of bodies dragging on the ground coming from the tunnel to her right.
She stepped into the tunnel to her left and the outline of a pair of giants came into view.  One dragged a collection of lifeless enormous sheep, goats, and cows behind him on a rope; the other carried a bundle of firewood under his arm.

“Let’s have a one of these as a snack at the Old Entrance.”  The first giant said in a deep, slow, almost childlike voice.
“Good idea, I’ve been bashing rock all through the night and I’m starvin’.”  Said his friend, in a slightly less deep, but equally uninflected tone.
“You ain’t starvin’, you fat oaf, you’re a greedy troll”
“Who you callin’ a troll, you goblin!”

And the two giants continued walking into the distance, exchanging clumsy insults and pushing each other into the wall, which sent vibrations through the rock.


“Trousers, what were those men?  I’ve never seen anyone so big in my life!”

“We are in the ogres’ lair.  My grandfather, Praetorius Pathfinder X (Known to his friends as Buttons for the dots on his belly) passed through here once.  He said the ogres are very stupid, but if they get a hold of you, they think it good sport to use you as a plaything -- and they play very rough indeed.  He also said to beware of -- watch out!”

And before Odessa could turn around, a pair of huge hands reached out of the shadows, grabbed her by the waist and lifted her high into the air.  Odessa’s vision was filled by a pair of huge yellow eyes and big yellow teeth.

“You’re an ugly little creature,” the ogress said.  “You’re the boniest, skinniest thing I’ve seen.”  The ogress’s breath hit Odessa’s face like a sulfurous tropical wind; Odessa gagged and coughed as she tried to reply.  The ogress put Odessa back down and prodded her, sending her flying back into the entrance tunnel.

“I’m sorry!” the ogress exclaimed, “I didn’t mean to hurt you.  Are you broken?”

“That’s alright,” Odessa replied, picking herself up.  “Who were those two ogres who came by?”

“They were a couple of rock workers; I saw them come up here and wanted to see what they were up to.  Now come back here before they grab you and decide to have you as a snack.”

The ogress wore a skirt and a top made of animal skin; she had vast legs like gelatinous tree trunks and a pot belly that her top barely concealedl.  Her skin was the colour of mustard and her limbs were roadmapped with protruding veins.  She had wiry hair that went just past her ears.  Having got over their astonishment at her sheer size and strangeness, Odessa examined the ogress’s face more appreciatively.  Her face had a couple of moles and what looked like a wart on the tip of her nose, and her teeth, though large and yellow, were quite straight.  Her big flat nose seemed about right for her round face, and her pointy ears stuck out of hair in a way that, if nothing else, suited her features.  Her almond shaped eyes examined Odessa intelligently.

“What are you, little things?” The ogress asked.

“My name is Odessa.  I’m a girl, or a woman I suppose.  What’s your name?”

“I am Turgolga, chieftain of the Roundbelly clan.”

“That sounds rather important.”

“Yes, we’re one of the leadings clans.  I’m also the head of the Council for Improvement and Creation,” Turgolga replied proudly.  “What’s that furry thing you’ve got there?”

“This is Trousers.  He’s a cat.”

“It looks like something that one of our animals might cough up.  Come to think of it, one of the old ogresses told me she had seen a furball like that once.  She had never seen anything move so fast -- she chased it, but it escaped to the Outside, and of course the ogres there lost track of it within minutes.  I always wondered what it looked like.  Quite unimpressive, I’ll say; and very skinny.  He’d barely be worth cooking by the looks of it.”

Odessa picked up Trousers and held him protectively.

“What are you doing here?”

“We’re travellers; we came here on a white bridge.  We need to find another one to continue our journey.”

“We’ve never had a traveller arrive by the Old Entrance.  There was a bridge that lead here once, but that was many years ago.”  Turgolga picked Odessa up again and sniffed her suspiciously. “I’m not sure what magic brought you here, but you seem harmless enough.”  She put Odessa back down and put her hands on her enormous hips.

“Tell me, what’s the difference between a girl and a woman?”

“It’s hard to say,” Odessa began, “but some people would say that when you’re a woman you’re too soft and delicate to run around and climb trees and wrestle with boys and build things and break things, but when you’re a girl you can do all those things.”

“So does that mean you start as a woman and then grow into a girl?”

“Not exactly,” Odessa replied.  “It’s usually the other way around.”

“How do you start tough and become soft?  I’ve never heard of such a thing.”

Odessa was about to reply that she herself was still trying to work it out, when the heavy footsteps of the returning ogres interrupted them.

“Quick, come with me,” Turgolga whispered, “I’ll take you home; you’ll be safe there.  And besides, I’d love to show you to the Council.”

“Will they eat us?”

“Not unless we vote unanimously to do so,” Turgolga replied without a hint of sarcasm.

As Turgolga set off, Odessa surreptitiously took a ball of bright string from her bag and let it trail out behind her.  They followed Turgolga into a dizzying labyrinth of tunnels, sometimes turning left, sometimes turning right, sometimes going straight ahead.  The walls of the tunnels were illuminated at regular intervals with crafted torches and decorated with delicate tribal patterns and artwork.

“These tunnels are incredible,” Odessa whispered.  “Who created all this?”

“We did, of course.”

“You mean the ogres?”

Turgolga snorted with laughter.  “What? No! Ogres can’t create anything -- except for some primitive patterns, I suppose.  Everything here was created by the ogresses.”

Odessa was confused.  “But those ogres who walked by looked enormously strong.  Why didn’t they help you?”

Turgolga sighed. (Although it sounded like a guttural snort)  “Clearly, you can’t tell the difference between creating and making.  The ogres did the stupid work of digging and carving, but you need ogresses to create the idea of doing so.  If you left an ogre to his own devices he’d simply bash his head against the rock, or rather bash another ogre’s head against the rock.  If it weren’t for the ogresses to keep the ogres in check, we’d all be huddled on the Entrance, shivering in the wind.”

“I think I understand,” Odessa replied.  “It must be difficult to live with ogres if they’re as rough and thick as that.”

“We do our best to keep them in check,” Turgolga sighed, “But life for an ogress was never meant to be easy.”

entry.title: Using Dynamic Stretches To Identify Muscle Weakness and Impingement
entry.content:
A demonstration of the dynamic stretches that I try to do every day.  I didn't demonstrate the lateral leg swings or some others, because my right hamstring was tight.




To release my hamstring, I activated my lower back and also did a modified clam shell glute activation exercise. (Not shown in the video)

As you can see, once I had done those two exercises, my hamstrings allowed me full range of motion, even to the degree of placing my palms on the floor with my feet at shoulder width and my legs straight.  I noticed that activating the quads helped with that, which makes sense, as they are the opposing muscles to the hamstrings.

I was very pleased to get a full range of motion in my front leg swings, as it is one of my favourite warm up exercises.

PROBLEMS:

I noticed quite severe arching of my back in my arm swings.
I'll add a basic gymnastic dish exercise to my warm up and see if that helps.

For a superb resource on this, check out Thomas Kurz's blog: http://tomkurz.wordpress.com/

entry.title: FAI Fix Schedule 2015
entry.content:
One of the biggest difficulties in following the FAI Fix is that it works so well.  This is a problem because I want to do everything, and have spent more time than I can afford doing tissue work and stretching.

Let's see how the following plan works out.  Feel free to take a copy and modify it for your own ends.

It's important to remember what external and internal rotation are, and what muscles are responsible for them. the internal rotators are generally in the inner thigh with the exception of the TFL. The external rotators are on the outside (posterior to greater trochanter). So when you do stretches to improve internal rotation, you'll often feel the resistance coming from the outer hip. When you stretch to improve external rotation, you'll feel the resistance in the inner thighs. [Thanks to Matt Hsu from Upright Health for the correction]

entry.title: Chapter XII: The Cleansing
entry.content:
https://www.flickr.com/photos/arash_rk/2380160367/sizes/o/
Turgolga emerged from her room wearing her finest jewellery, bangles, bracelets, and rings.  She placed the picnic basket in front of Odessa and Trousers.  “Let's go!”

Odessa and Trousers climbed into Turgolga’s picnic basket and this time they were carried by Tazagthrog, along with Yugherkug, Yamizert, and Turgolga to a grand square covered with a mosaic of stark tribal patterns.  At the centre of the square was a stage shaped like an altar, on which stood an imposing wooden cross.  At the foot of the cross was a bundle of firewood.

The square was filled with a crowd of ogres to the right and a crowd of ogresses to the left, with a path to the stage between them.  The ogres stood at attention, their eyes fixed on Yugherkug, their scaly faces blank; there was a buzz of excitement about the ogresses, although they paid little attention to Yugherkug.

Turgolga deposited the basket on nearby boulder.  Odessa with Trousers on her shoulder peeked out at the stage.
The Roundbelly family made its way to the front of the stage and turned to face the crowd.  Turgolga stepped raised her palms to the crowd; the ogresses hushed.

“Today is a proud day for the Roundbelly family.  I have tried to make the most of Yugherkug, but there is only so much one can expect from an ogreson.”  The ogresses in the crowd tutted and laughed in agreement; the ogres stood in silence, mostly staring at the ground.

“Ever since he was born, he has been a typical ogre.  If you tell him something once, you’ve told him it –“

“A thousand times!” Half of the crowd replied.

“And although I’ve been patient with him,” Turgolga continued, “there is no limit to the trouble he has caused.  But nobody said an ogress’s life was easy.”  Half the crowd shouted in agreement.

“Come, let’s not waste any more of your time on this filthy rock snake.  I should like to call upon my sisters to commence the Cleansing.”

Three ogresses stepped forward from the crowd and joined Turgolga in grabbing Yugherkug's limbs.  They tied him to the cross with ropes, his feet together, his arms out to his sides.  He looked down at Tazagthrog; Tazagthrog looked up at him, his body erect, his fists clenched.  For a moment, Odessa thought Tazagthrog was going to step on to the platform, but two ogres put their hands on his shoulders and he stepped back into the crowd; he put his arms around the shoulders of two large ogres in the front row.  They put their arms around his back and stood stiffly at attention with him.

Yamizert proffered the wooden box to her mother.  Turgolga opened it and held up the hunting knife to the crowd.  The ogresses cheered wildly; Yamizert left the stage and went to stand next to Odessa and Trousers on the boulder.  “What’s going on?” Odessa asked.  “Yugherkug’s Cleansing,” Yamizert replied in a soft monotone.  She leaned weakly against the boulder and stared at the ground.  “Aren’t you happy for your brother?” Odessa asked, but Yamizert didn’t reply.  Her pointed ears drooped and her arms were wrapped tightly around her midriff.

“With this knife, I trace our people’s struggle against the belly of the mountain.” Turgolga announced.  The ogresses in the crowd stamped their feet and clapped their hands to a slow, expectant beat.  Turgolga placed the knife against the front of Yugherkug’s right shoulder and cut a line to his left hip.  He gritted his teeth and clenched his body.  A row of bloody droplets was released like ropes from a bridge down his torso.  Then a long incision from his left shoulder to his right hip.  Then a series of crisscrossed lines across his chest and abdomen, his thighs and his arms.  All the while, Yugherkug gritted his teeth, but his moans were drowned out by the laughter and clapping from the crowd.  When Turgolga finished her knife-work, Yugherkug’s body from his shoulders to his feet was painted a glistening crimson that formed a pool on the stage and dripped down to the square.

Turgolga turned to face the crowd, the bloody knife in her hand, beaming with proud delight.  The ogresses ululated and clapped their hands.  Yugherkug looked pleadingly at his mother as she turned to face him.  She reached up to his left ear and deftly sliced off the top part.  Yugherkug screamed and writhed with such ferocity that Odessa could hear him over the banshee roar of the ululations and thought that the cross would break.  After a minute he dropped his head and gasped for breath.  Turgolga quickly moved across and sliced his other ear and then roughly rolled down the wounded portions to form neat, round ears.  Yugherkug screamed and writhed, as if an electric current were passing through him, until it too passed, and his head dropped again.

An ogress brought a burning torch to Turgolga and waved to the crowd as she exited the stage.  Turgolga brandished the torch and then applied it to the firewood at Yugherkug’s feet.  The kindling burst into flames; within seconds Yugherkug and the cross were engulfed in fire.

Odessa gasped in horror.  “Yamizert, what’s going on?  Why are they doing this?”

Yamizert kept on staring at the ground.  “It’s what we do.  Ogres have to be tough.”

“But he’s going to die!”

“No he won’t.  Not if he’s strong.”

The flames soon died down, leaving Yugherkug’s body completely charred.  The crowd fell silent again.  But then, a curious thing happened: reptilian scales began to push through.  From his feet to his head, except for his ears, the charred flesh fell off Yugherkug and within a few minutes, he was encased in a full body armour of scales.  The ropes and the cross disintegrated, and he collapsed on to the stage.  He tried to stand up, and when he looked at the crowd his sea-blues eyes had turned deep orange.  Tazagthrog rushed forward, slung him over his shoulder, and disappeared into the ogre side of the crowd.

Turgolga summoned Yamizert to the stage and officiously returned the knife to her, before patting her head affectionately.  The ogresses whooped and cheered; Turgolga waved to them like an opera singer and they dispersed.  Turgolga picked up Odessa and Trousers' basket and headed back home.

“Will Yugherkug be alright?”  Odessa asked nervously.

“Maybe now that he’s been Cleansed.”

Odessa looked at Yamizert who was walking alongside them, but Yamizert stared straight ahead.

When they got back to the Roundbelly home, Yugherkug was lying on the side of the road with Tazagthrog gently washing away the last of his charred flesh.  Yugherkug’s ears were bandaged.

That night, after Turgolga had drunk herself into a stupor and Yamizert had disappeared into the night, Odessa and Trousers heard voices outside.  They peeked out the front entrance and spied Tazagthrog and Yugherkug sitting next to each other with their legs crossed and their hands on their knees, facing the road.  Yugherkug scratched his sides.

“These scales are itchy, Father.”

Tazagthrog tensed at the word “father” and checked over his shoulder to see if anyone had heard them.  Odessa and Trousers pulled their heads in; when they peeked back out, they saw Tazagthrog’s right hand resting lightly on his son’s shoulder.

“I know Yugherkug, you’ll get used to them soon.”

They sat in silence, staring at the road.

“Why did I have to be Cleansed?  Was I dirty?”

“Some ogres say we're born dirty, and we have to be Cleansed to deserve being chosen by an ogress.”

“Do you say that?”

“I don't know.  But it makes us tough.”

“I know.  But why do we have to be tough?”

“If you aren’t tough, no ogress will choose you.”

“I heard that little creature that Mother brought home talking about their ogrefolk.  She said that their ogres don’t have to have a thick skin like ours; they’re allowed to be as soft as their ogresses.  Why can’t we be like that?”

“I don’t know, Yugherkug.  Maybe life is meant to be easier for those little creatures.  But we can’t change who we are.”

“It doesn’t seem fair.”

“Life isn’t fair, Yugherkug.  Now try to get some sleep: tomorrow you’ll start working with me in the Outside.  Working with the animals and the getting some sunlight will do you good.”

Yugherkug shifted to his bed of hay and was soon snoring peacefully.  Tazagthrog stood up quietly; his eyes glowed amber in the dark.  He turned around and walked down the road towards the great northern wall.

entry.title: Get Involved!
entry.content:
The Odessia was started as a group endeavour and shall forever be so.  As I said back in my introductory post Creative Commons, Free Culture, and A Modest Dream:
It is my heart's desire that some of you who enjoy these stories will use these ideas and my imagery for your own creations.  If we all link to this blog and share these stories, then my work can serve as a platform for your sketches, your graphic design work (if you'd like to create a template for the blog, for example), your music, your audio production talent -- I will record readings --, your voice acting,  your video production, your animation, your acting on camera, your live performance, your translations, your editing, your own writing.
To this end, the following is a wishlist of contributions that would go a long way towards realizing this dream.  If you think of something else you'd like to do, please get in touch with me via the Contact Form, Google+, or the Facebook page!

Visual/Graphic

  • Profile picture for all accounts under the name The Odessia, rather than my annoying mug.
  • Sketches of Odessa, Trousers, or any other character (the more the merrier)
  • Sketches of the scenes described in The Odessia (the more the merrier)
  • Any artwork inspired by The Odessia (the more the merrier)
  • Favicon
  • Header image
  • Blog template for Blogger or Wordpress

     Audio/Musical

    • Sound effects for audiobook recordings of The Odessia
    • Background music for The Odessia
    • Audio editing of readings of The Odessia
    • Readings of The Odessia on your own channel or podcast
    • Discussion or critique of The Odessia on your own channel or podcast

       Writing/Editing

      • Feedback in the comments, via email or social media -- this one's really easy and would help me a lot!
      • Comments on the Release Candidates in the Google Docs
      • Any other editing, critique, or feedback
      • Translation into your own language

entry.title: Isolated Stretches vs Compound Stretches
entry.content:
In three months, even though I have not spent a single minute on the front splits, I have improved my range in the front splits at least as much as this fellow here:

http://antranik.org/90-days-splits-challenge-results/
How have I achieved such an increase in static passive flexibility without training for this movement?

Through consistent application of isolated stretches to the muscles along the chain.

A very common approach to stretching is to prescribe compound stretches [movements that require a high degree of mobility throughout a chain of muscles] to people who cannot perform them.
Nowhere else in physical training is this approach taken: compound resistance exercises are broken down into their components, technical skills are built up from their components, and wherever you look, a competent trainer will "break it down" for you and help you to piece it together.

But flexibility training is all to often an exercise in futility.

If you, like me, have always had poor flexibility, imagine going to a class of adult gymnastics and being asked to follow the supple gymnasts who move easily through demanding compound stretches.  How has that worked out for you?  Are you any better?  Or do you simply accept that stretching is meant to be frustrating and humiliating for you?  Have you been sold the "onion ring" theory, that the restriction in various muscle groups will over time "peel away", and one day, over the rainbow, you will move freely throughout the compound stretch?

This makes no sense whatsoever to me.

My approach is to use a compound stretch to identify where the restriction is, and once I have found it, to laser in on it with the following:
  1. Resistance training
  2. Tissue work
  3. Targeted stretching
For example, if you are to achieve the front splits, you need a considerable range of motion in the following:
  1. Quadriceps
  2. Adductors
  3. Hamstrings
  4. Calves
  5. Glutes
If you are restricted in any of these areas, you will find yourself very far off the ground, unable to progress.  If you try to do the splits without targetting each and every area, you will simply spend a lot of time wobbling in the air, feeling silly.  Moreover, your nervous system will not permit you to relax in this pose and any significant increase in range of motion, if to be achieved at all, will be done extremely inefficiently.  Add to that bruising and discomfort from sustained pressure on joints (especially your knees) that bear your weight because you can't move far enough in the stretch to get off them.

Over the past couple of months I have been cycling through each of the major areas with targeted resistance training, targeted tissue work, and targeted stretching.
  1. Quadriceps
  2. Adductors
  3. Hamstrings
  4. Glutes
  5. External hip rotators
  6. Calves
  7. Hip flexors
I work towards specific goals for each muscle group, and have sought static stretches that permit the greatest degree of relaxation, application of external resistance, and the easiest enhancement by means of PNF. (Proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation)

And the result?  A huge increase in range of motion, stronger muscles, and the confidence that comes with following a rational, science-based system of training.  When I achieve the splits -- without training specifically for it --, I will append photos to the end of this post.

entry.title: Freight Calculator Prototype: LAMP Stack on an EC2 written in PHP
entry.content:
Here is a crude, but illustrative beginning of an application I'm working on:

http://52.62.159.146/form.html
It is hosted on an Amazon EC2 instance that I created, running Ubuntu 16.04 with Apache2, MySQL 5.7, and PHP7.
I can SFTP using FileZilla and I have set a BASH script on all my computers to log into it automatically
An Ubuntu EC2 instance is 14.04 by default, but I did a full system upgrade over SSH. (It was fun)
Obviously, I'm doing everything on the command line, and for editing the files I'm using Nano -- it's not Vim or Emacs, but it's good enough for me.
The inspiration for this project comes straight from my job.
The working "app" is a Google sheet that I built to automate the calculation of freight so that the sales staff wouldn't pester me to measure and weigh products and look up shipping rates
I obtained all the shipping rates from our current courier and have been measuring and weighing the products methodically
At this point, 9/10 shipping estimates are fully automated and I can get on with other tasks, so the task is to replicate the full functionality of the spreadsheet in a website, hosted on an EC2 instance, running a full LAMP stack, written in PHP that creates records and returns shipping estimates by interacting with a MySQL database
The Google sheet works just fine for the people in the office, but I hope to use this web application to showcase my skills and other desirable traits in a development role
Obviously, it's not very pretty, but if you understand how these things work (I assume you do), then you'll understand how much one needs to learn in order to get to this point.

entry.title: The Robots Who Attained Self-Awareness
entry.content:
I've been listening to the audiobook of the Selfish Gene by Richard Dawkins, in which he argues that all creatures are like robots that have been blindly constructed over the aeons by the genes.  All the behaviours of animals, and the natural impulses of Man, have been "programmed".  More accurately, this means that the general rules that animals instinctively follow, e.g. "fight or flight" in the face of danger, were the most successful at spreading genes in a given gene pool.

 Man is different: Man can control his impulses.  Moreover, Man can retrain his intuitions and reflexes to over-ride his instincts.  I see chocolate in the supermarket; but no longer see it as a tasty snack; I jump from a high obstacle, but no longer fear the drop; I see a beautiful woman, but no longer consider her desirable for I can see that she is vacuous.

 We, the robots, the survival machines, are the living Borg.  We are the robots who attained self-awareness.
It is a great job, I like your posts and wish you all the best. and I hope you continue this job well. NutraT line
